channel.title: Higher resolution desktop
channel.description:
Can you please provide higher resolutions for desktop and possibly have them on out of the box so all users configs conform to one another?
1024x768 is too limited for modern computer screens and so make little sense. They make reading in the workstation uncomfortable.

item.title: Higher resolution desktop
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
If Debian fixed #1004154 - xserver-xorg-video-qxl: XOrg frequently crashes when using qxl driver: qxl(0): error doing QXL_ALLOC - Debian Bug report logs this Debian testing migration bug might fix itself. But if not, then I don‚Äôt know.

Kicksecure Forums ‚Äì 6 Nov 22

Kicksecure-xfce-host not installable in debian 12 (removed dependency)

Affects Kicksecure KVM only. Whonix is also affected, reported here just now: If not resolved at time when porting to Debian 12, I would have to remove that dependency package. I am not a maintainer of Kicksecure KVM. //cc @HulaHoop

Read full topic

item.title: Higher resolution desktop
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
That page will still be required for VirtualBox. The package might at best only set 1366x768 for KVM users and do nothing for VirtualBox users (due to the other issue(s) with VirtualBox). But‚Ä¶ When these VBox issues are solved, this package may at best set 1366x768 for KVM as well as for VirtualBox users.

Read full topic

item.description:
I don‚Äôt really care much for VirtualBox but I want to still help you support this for it.

Does it only work with it using instructions here? If not then this page can be deprecated.

Whonix ‚Äì 16 Sep 19

VirtualBox/Higher Screen Resolution without installing VirtualBox Guest...

Higher Screen Resolution without installing VirtualBox guest additions

item.title: Higher resolution desktop
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Patrick:

New page https://github.com/Whonix/kde-common-resolution will be installed by default in Whonix 10 and above. It ships a setting to set resolution to 1366x768 in KDE and VirtualBox (the latter won‚Äôt work until we sort out the issue with VirtualBox and resolutions without guest additions) in KDE.

Entirely untested!

Read full topic

item.title: Higher resolution desktop

New page https://github.com/Whonix/kde-common-resolution will be installed by default in Whonix 10 and above. It ships a setting to set resolution to 1366x768 in KDE and VirtualBox (the latter won‚Äôt work until we sort out the issue with VirtualBox and resolutions without guest additions) in KDE.

item.title: Higher resolution desktop
item.dc:creator: HulaHoop
item.description:
A sane default is the one most widely used, which happens to be 1366x768

http://www.rapidtables.com/web/dev/screen-resolution-statistics.htm

Which KVM resolution by default would they most benefit? And would we screw up things for other users by shipping another resolution the default in KVM?

Its easy to switch resolutions from the KDE settings menu. we can make a short note about it in documentation for people unfamiliar with KDE, but I don‚Äôt think its needed.

Having 1024x768 as a default annoys pretty much everyone using Whonix as its mostly gone now.

Read full topic

item.title: Higher resolution desktop
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Also what would be a good default choice?

Resolution seems quite fragmented.
http://www.w3schools.com/browsers/browsers_display.asp

What do most users use on the host?

Which KVM resolution by default would they most benefit? And would we screw up things for other users by shipping another resolution the default in KVM?

Read full topic

item.title: Higher resolution desktop
item.dc:creator: HulaHoop
item.description:
https://www.whonix.org/forum/index.php/topic,493.msg4084.html#msg4084

I followed it to the letter this time but same outcome.

I don‚Äôt think it changes anything. The only enhancement I can think of is for whonixadvanced setup or whatever you see fit for this, to the range of resolutions qxl supports upon first run for users to select from. If this is too time consuming, forget about it.

Read full topic

item.title: Higher resolution desktop
item.dc:creator: HulaHoop
item.description:
What happens?

The guest resolution stays 1024x768 and fills the whole host screen becuase the host is the same lower resolution during the test.

Read full topic

item.title: Higher resolution desktop
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
There is one important test that needs to be done before shipping such a config so or so‚Ä¶

Set a KVM VM to a higher resolution than 1024x768.

Let‚Äôs imagine a user who can set at maximum 1024x768 on its host (or is using this for other reasons such as accessibility)‚Ä¶ Please simulate being that user. Shut down the KVM VM. Set your host to 1024x768. Now start the KVM VM.

What happens? Will the KVM VM (that maybe will attempt setting a higher resolution than the host has currently set) still be usable? Or will some weird bug hapen? Screen still readable? Or VM window must be scrolled? With what resolution the KVM VM will start?

Read full topic

item.title: Higher resolution desktop
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
[quote=‚ÄúHulaHoop, post:37, topic:471‚Äù]https://www.whonix.org/forum/index.php/topic,493.msg4084.html#msg4084

I don‚Äôt think I understand how things work.[/quote]
This is unfortunate. I wouldn‚Äôt know how to explain better.

I‚Äôve explained the issue on kde user mailing list in slightly different words:
http://lists.kde.org/?l=kde&m=141130406809446&w=2

Hopefully they have suggestions on how to ease debugging.

HulaHoop:

Alternatively please have Whonix ship the qxl xserver package and I‚Äôll manually set the resolution from the gui after upgrades.

Will be the case in next release.

Read full topic

item.title: Higher resolution desktop
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
The question is, does that config work for you?

/usr/share/whonix-ws-kde-desktop-conf/share/config/krandrrc

[Screen_0_Output_default]
Rect=0,0,1366,768

Have you debugged it as per https://www.whonix.org/forum/index.php/topic,493.msg4084.html#msg4084? Start testing with 1024x768 with user and then see if user2 ends up with changed different resolution thanks to that new config.

Read full topic

item.title: Higher resolution desktop
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Using /usr/share/whonix-gw-kde-desktop-conf/share/config/krandrrc would also ship with hi-res out of the box for new build versions as per https://www.whonix.org/forum/index.php/topic,493.msg4084.html#msg4084. Not for existing users that upgrade.

Read full topic

item.title: Higher resolution desktop
item.dc:creator: HulaHoop
item.description:
Yes. Would have to be hardcoded to /home/user/.kde/share/config/krandrrc. Why would that be required, what would that be good for?

Its one option thats about shipping Whonix with a hi-res out of the box, or alternatively the documentation tells people how to adjust this from KDE settings.

Read full topic

item.title: Higher resolution desktop
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
[quote=‚ÄúHulaHoop, post:29, topic:471‚Äù]The file at /usr/share/whonix-ws-kde-desktop-conf/share/config/krandrrc
does not override whatever is at ~/.kde/share/config/krandrrc[/quote]
I know. I tried to explain that here:
https://www.whonix.org/forum/index.php/topic,493.msg4084.html#msg4084

Is it possible to just ship with a modified ~/.kde/share/config/krandrrc even though its not good practice?
Yes. Would have to be hardcoded to /home/user/.kde/share/config/krandrrc. Why would that be required, what would that be good for?

Read full topic

item.title: Higher resolution desktop
item.dc:creator: HulaHoop
item.description:
The file at /usr/share/whonix-ws-kde-desktop-conf/share/config/krandrrc
does not override whatever is at ~/.kde/share/config/krandrrc

~/.kde/share/config/krandrrc

[code][Screen_0]
OutputsUnified=false
UnifiedRect=0,0,0,0
UnifiedRotation=1

[Screen_0_Output_default]
Active=true
Rect=0,0,1024,768
RefreshRate=75
Rotation=1
[/code]

/usr/share/whonix-ws-kde-desktop-conf/share/config/krandrrc

[code][Screen_0]
OutputsUnified=false
UnifiedRect=0,0,0,0
UnifiedRotation=1

[Screen_0_Output_default]
Active=true
Rect=0,0,1366,768
RefreshRate=60
Rotation=1[/code]

Is it possible to just ship with a modified ~/.kde/share/config/krandrrc even though its not good practice?

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
[quote=‚ÄúHulaHoop, post:25, topic:471‚Äù][quote]Also this is specific to VBox vs KVM.
[/quote]

I have been trying to get krandrrc to work but I think the problem is I don‚Äôt know what the KVM naming scheme is. Searches don‚Äôt show anything useful.

I really want this to work but I‚Äôm at a loss as to what to do next.[/quote]
You don‚Äôt have to know that by search. You can know this by ‚Äúreverse engineering‚Äù. Just change your resolution a few times. Then that file should get created.
